meanings.definition: A gymnastic exercise in which a person turns head over heels in a sideways motion with the hands touching the ground alternately.
meanings.sent1: During the gymnastics class, Sarah performed perfect cartwheels across the mat.
meanings.sent2: The children in the park were practicing cartwheels on the soft grass.
meanings.sent3: The clown attempted to do cartwheels but ended up tumbling comically instead.
meanings.sent4: Her joy was like a cartwheel, spinning freely and full of energy.
meanings.sent5: The image of cartwheels in the sand was etched in his memory.

meanings.definition: A circular movement resembling a cartwheel, especially one made by a vehicle.
meanings.sent1: The windmill's blades spun in a cartwheel motion as the breeze picked up.
meanings.sent2: The cartwheels of the old-fashioned carriage creaked along the cobblestone street.
meanings.sent3: The colorful Ferris wheel looked like a giant cartwheel in the amusement park.
meanings.sent4: The cartwheel of colors in the kaleidoscope mesmerized the child.
meanings.sent5: The cartwheel of stars in the night sky was a breathtaking sight.
